title: California fires rage through homes, hills Photos
text:
A firefighter puts out hotspots near the Getty Fire area in Los Angeles, Oct. 28, 2019. Ringo H.w. Chiu/AP

The Getty fire burns a hillside next to the 405 freeway in Los Angeles on Monday, Oct. 28, 2019. (Kyle Grillot/The New York Times) Kyle Grillot/The New York Times via Redux

Firefighters work to contain a burning structure during the wind-driven Kincade Fire in Windsor, California, Oct. 27, 2019. Stephen Lam/Reuters

Firefighters survey Soda Rock Winery as it begins to burn during the Kincade fire in Healdsburg, Calif., Oct. 27, 2019. Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images

The Kincade Fire approaches a herd of alpacas in Sonoma County, Calif., Oct. 27, 2019. Ethan Swope/AP

A firefighter walks through a burned property after the Kincade fire tore through Healdsburg, Calif., Oct. 27, 2019. Josh Edelson/AFP/Getty Images

Firefighters hose down a burning house during the Tick Fire in Agua Dulce near Santa Clarita, Calif., Oct. 25, 2019. Mark Ralston/AFP via Getty Images

Firefighters with the Marin County Fire Department begin to dig a containment line ahead of the Kincade Fire, in the Geysers, a geothermal field in California, Oct. 25, 2019. Max Whittaker/The New York Times via Redux

Josie Hernandez holds her dog "Cookie" while evacuating as the Tick fire roared into Baker Canyon, Oct. 24, 2019, in Canyon Country, Calif. David Crane/Orange County Register via Zuma Press

Embers fly across a roadway as the Kincade Fire burns through the Jimtown community of Sonoma County, Calif., Oct. 24, 2019. Noah Berger/AP

The rising sun peers through the smoke over a property lost to the Kincade Fire near Geyserville, Calif., Oct. 24, 2019. Peter DaSilva/EPA via Shutterstock

Firefighters confer while battling the Kincade Fire near Geyserville, Calif., Oct. 24, 2019. Portions of Northern California remain in the dark after Pacific Gas & Electric Co. cut power to prevent wildfires from sparking during dry and windy conditions. Noah Berger/AP
description: Thousands are being evacuated and power outages are in effect to protect those in high risk areas.
